meanings.definition: The quality of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The illusivenesses of the magician's tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The illusivenesses of the mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent3: The illusivenesses of the optical illusion made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The illusivenesses of the ghostly figure sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The illusivenesses of the hidden treasure captured their imagination.

meanings.definition: The state of being difficult to grasp or understand.
meanings.sent1: The illusivenesses of the concept confused the students in class.
meanings.sent2: The illusivenesses of the theory challenged even the most experienced scientists.
meanings.sent3: The illusivenesses of the riddle kept them entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: The illusivenesses of the elusive answer lingered in their minds.
meanings.sent5: The illusivenesses of the complex problem required a fresh perspective to solve.
